metadata.name: Initiative_Template
metadata.source: Generated based on SDLC Artifacts Comprehensive Guideline v1.1

instructions.guideline: Align initiative with organizational business goals and OKRs
Define measurable business outcomes (not output metrics)
Time horizon: Quarters to full year (3-12 months)
Initiative drives multiple epics and features
Link business strategy to product execution

template.structure:
# Initiative: [Initiative Title]
## Metadata - **Initiative ID:** INIT-[XXX] - **Status:** [Draft/Approved/In Progress/Completed/Cancelled] - **Priority:** [Strategic/High/Medium] - **Owner:** [Executive Sponsor Name & Title] - **Business Unit:** [Product/Engineering/Sales/etc.] - **Time Horizon:** [Q1-Q3 2025] - **Budget:** $[Amount] - **Related Strategy Doc:** [Link to portfolio/business strategy]
## Strategic Objective
**Initiative Statement:** [One-sentence strategic objective that aligns with organizational goals]
**Business Context:** [Why this initiative matters now - market opportunity, competitive threat, internal capability gap]
## Business Goals & OKRs
### Objective [High-level qualitative goal this initiative achieves]
### Key Results
| Key Result | Baseline | Target | Due Date | Owner | |-----------|----------|--------|----------|-------| | [Measurable outcome 1] | [Current state] | [Goal state] | [Date] | [Name] | | [Measurable outcome 2] | [Current state] | [Goal state] | [Date] | [Name] | | [Measurable outcome 3] | [Current state] | [Goal state] | [Date] | [Name] |
**Success Criteria:** - [ ] Key Result 1 achieved (≥80% of target) - [ ] Key Result 2 achieved (≥80% of target) - [ ] Key Result 3 achieved (≥80% of target)
## Strategic Alignment
### Organizational Strategy [How this initiative supports company strategy, mission, vision]
### Portfolio Priorities [Where this initiative ranks among portfolio priorities]

## Scope & Approach

### In Scope - [Strategic capability 1] - [Strategic capability 2] - [Strategic capability 3]

## Resource Allocation
### Budget Breakdown | Category | Allocated | Spent to Date | Remaining | |----------|-----------|---------------|-----------| | Engineering | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | | Design/UX | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | | Infrastructure | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | | Marketing/GTM | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | $[Amount] | | **Total** | **$[Amount]** | **$[Amount]** | **$[Amount]** |
### Team Allocation - **Full-Time Equivalent (FTE):** [Total FTE across teams] - **Teams Involved:** [List of teams contributing] - **Organizational Commitment:** [% of portfolio capacity]
## Risks & Dependencies
### Strategic Risks
| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation Strategy | Owner | |------|------------|--------|-------------------|-------| | [Market risk 1] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] | [Name] | | [Execution risk 2] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] | [Name] | | [Financial risk 3] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] | [Name] |

**External Dependencies:** - [Partner/vendor dependency 1] - [Regulatory/compliance dependency 2]
**Internal Dependencies:** - [Cross-team dependency 1] - [Platform/infrastructure dependency 2]
**Blocking Initiatives:** - [INIT-XXX: Must complete before this initiative]
## Success Metrics & Tracking
### Primary Metrics (Outcomes)
| Metric | Measurement Frequency | Current | Target | Tracking Method | |--------|---------------------|---------|--------|----------------| | [Business metric 1] | [Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly] | [Value] | [Goal] | [Dashboard/Report] | | [Business metric 2] | [Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly] | [Value] | [Goal] | [Dashboard/Report] |
### Secondary Metrics (Leading Indicators)
| Metric | Measurement Frequency | Target | Purpose | |--------|---------------------|--------|---------| | [Leading indicator 1] | [Frequency] | [Goal] | [Why tracked] | | [Leading indicator 2] | [Frequency] | [Goal] | [Why tracked] |
### Progress Dashboard [Link to real-time dashboard tracking initiative progress]
## Milestones & Timeline
### Phase 1: Foundation (Month 1-3) - **Milestone 1.1** (End Month 1): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 1.2** (End Month 2): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 1.3** (End Month 3): [Deliverable]
### Phase 2: Build (Month 4-6) - **Milestone 2.1** (End Month 4): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 2.2** (End Month 5): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 2.3** (End Month 6): [Deliverable]
### Phase 3: Scale (Month 7-9) - **Milestone 3.1** (End Month 7): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 3.2** (End Month 8): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 3.3** (End Month 9): [Deliverable]
## Governance & Decision-Making
### Steering Committee - [Executive Sponsor Name] - [Title] - [Committee Member 2] - [Title] - [Committee Member 3] - [Title]
### Review Cadence - **Weekly:** Execution team sync - **Bi-Weekly:** Progress review with stakeholders - **Monthly:** Steering committee review - **Quarterly:** Executive business review
### Decision Authority - **Scope Changes:** [Who approves] - **Budget Variance (>10%):** [Who approves] - **Timeline Changes:** [Who approves] - **Initiative Cancellation:** [Who approves]
## Communication Plan
### Stakeholder Updates - **Executive Leadership:** [Frequency & format] - **Contributing Teams:** [Frequency & format] - **Broader Organization:** [Frequency & format] - **Customers:** [If applicable - timing & messaging]
### Communication Channels - [Slack channel / Email list / Wiki page] - [All-hands presentation schedule] - [External communication plan]
## Definition of Success
**Initiative Completed When:** - [ ] All Key Results achieved (≥80% of targets) - [ ] All supporting epics completed - [ ] Success metrics baseline validated - [ ] Business impact measured and documented - [ ] Go-to-market (if applicable) executed - [ ] Post-initiative retrospective completed - [ ] Lessons learned documented
## Open Questions & Assumptions
### Open Questions - [Strategic question 1] - [Resource question 2] - [Market question 3]
### Key Assumptions - [Assumption 1: Market condition or constraint] - [Assumption 2: Resource availability] - [Assumption 3: Technical feasibility]
## Related Documents - **Business Strategy:** [Link to organizational strategy doc] - **Initiative PRD:** [Link if separate detailed PRD exists] - **Market Research:** [Link to supporting research] - **Competitive Analysis:** [Link to analysis] - **Supporting Epics:** [Links to epic documents] - **Architecture Decisions:** [Links to relevant ADRs]

examples.example:
# Initiative: Increase Mobile App Engagement by 20%
## Strategic Objective Drive mobile app engagement to increase customer lifetime value and reduce churn in our retail banking segment.
## Business Goals & OKRs
### Objective Make our mobile app the primary banking channel for retail customers
### Key Results | Key Result | Baseline | Target | Due Date | |-----------|----------|--------|----------| | Monthly Active Users (MAU) | 150K | 180K (+20%) | Q4 2025 | | Average Session Duration | 2.5 min | 4.0 min (+60%) | Q4 2025 | | Churn Rate | 5% | 4.25% (-15%) | Q4 2025 |
## Supporting Epics | Epic | Description | Timeline | |------|-------------|----------| | EPIC-101 | Proactive push notifications | Q1-Q2 2025 | | EPIC-102 | In-app financial insights | Q2-Q3 2025 | | EPIC-103 | One-tap bill payments | Q3 2025 |
## Success Metrics - MAU growth tracked weekly via Mixpanel - Session duration measured via Firebase Analytics - Churn calculated monthly from customer database
